ai.summary: A short, easy 0.7 km woodland stroll on Bourne Wood's Purple Route in the UK. This family-friendly trail weaves through shaded pines and open glades, with a flat to gently undulating path and well-defined tracks.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently undulating forest terrain. Well-defined dirt and gravel paths with occasional tree roots and compact sections. Expect shaded sections and occasional sunlight filtering through the canopy.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked trails; wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing; be mindful of uneven surfaces and tree roots; carry water and a small snack; check the forecast and bring a light rain jacket; watch for ticks and insects and use repellent; supervise children and dogs (on a leash where required); obey signage and any forestry work zones; in case of emergency, contact the local ranger or emergency services as appropriate.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or light boots
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers; waterproof jacket if rain is forecast)
Water bottle and a small snack
Map or offline navigation (or route description)
Phone with a charged battery and, if possible, a portable power bank
ai.best_seasons: All year; best conditions typically from spring to autumn when paths are drier and daylight is longer.

seo.title: Bourne Wood Purple Route – Easy 0.7 km Woodland Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Bourne Wood Purple Route, a 0.7 km easy woodland walk in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons to visit.
